page.title: 14Class Assemblies
page.content: Each week a class at Great Horwood School takes a turn in leading the school assembly. Quite often the class responsible will present a short play or series of sketches to make their point. Sometimes the assembly will show the rest of the school ideas which have come out of the work the class are studying at present. One class had been studying food and presented an assembly about breakfasts around the world. They made the point about the lack of food in many countries, particularly in {Ethiopia} and the {Sudan} and made a collection for famine relief. Another class presented a modern day version of {The Good Samaritan},where the traveller was mugged by youths on BMX bikes. A lively assembly which made its point.
